titles.title: Ste. Genevieve National Historical Park Establishment Act
To establish the Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site in the State of Missouri, and for other purposes.

action.text: Mr. Gosar moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2888.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 115-237.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 392.

bill.summary:
Ste. Genevieve National Historical Park Establishment Act
This bill establishes the Ste. Genevieve National Historical Park in Missouri as a unit of the National Park System.
The Department of the Interior may acquire by donation, purchase, or exchange any land or interest in land located within the park's boundary or any nationally significant property identified in the special resource study that is within the Ste. Genevieve Historic District National Historic Landmark.
